July 21
  • 7th Detroit Festival of Books! (aka: Detroit Bookfest)
  • Sunday, July 21, 2024
    • 10am - 4pm
  • FREE entry!
  • Festival takes place at Eastern Market Shed 5
    • (Shed 5 is wheelchair-accessible)
  • Featuring more than 100 vendors from all over the USA & Canada, selling BOOKS:
    • Used
    • Rare
    • Antiquarian
    • Unusual
    • Ephemera
    • Authors - and more
  • ALSO Tons of
    • Vinyl records
    • Comic books
    • Creative arts
    • Vintage board games -  and more!
  • Enjoy FOOD, BEER,  and DJ Seven Whales bringing the FUNK MUSIC!
  • KID-FRIENDLY EVENT! Children in attendance may construct their very own book with the assistance of volunteers from 'Arts & Scraps', a Detroit-based nonprofit that helps children repurpose discarded materials into educational and creative projects.
  • We are pleased to announce the participation of Birdie’s Bookmobile at at this year’s festival. Birdie’s Bookmobile is dedicated to eliminating book deserts and making books more accessible to children in Detroit. Birdie’s Bookmobile helps families build print-rich home environments, improve literacy outcomes, and grow lifelong readers. In addition to accepting donations of children’s and young-adult books, the bookmobile will be offering several fun activities for children attending this year’s Bookfest, including:
    • Create Your Own Comic Strip
    • Have Fun with Mad Libs
    • “Once Upon a Time” — children take turns adding one sentence to a story. The story will be available to read on the Bookmobile website after Bookfest.
  • There is no admission fee at Bookfest, nor is there any charge for children to participate in any activities.
    • Book donations help build home libraries, promote shared reading experiences, and impact generations. Every book counts! Book needs for children from birth to age 18 include:
      • board books • picture books • early readers
      • chapter books • graphic novels
      • middle-grade books
      • young-adult books
  • Questions? books@detroitbookfest.com
  • Bookfest Home Page
  • Facebook Event Page
  • CLICK HERE for all the event details!
  • Want to see the size of Shed 5? Click here for a virtual tour
  • Come enjoy this glorious day of BOOKS, vinyl records, comics, creative arts, food, beer, funk music and more! What's not to love?!
  • Check the Bookfest photos from last year!

Library: Friends of the St. Charles City-County Library Book Sale
SaleDetails:
Aug 2 - 4
  • ST. CHARLES CITY-COUNTY LIBRARY -- FRIENDS OF THE LIBRARY 2024 SUMMER BOOK FAIR
  • August 2, 3, & 4
  • One of the largest Book Fairs in the St. Louis area
  • Over 250,000 items including hardbacks, paperbacks, cake pans, sets, and AV material
  • The 2024 Friends Summer Book Fair will be held at the Family Arena, 2002 Arena Parkway, St. Charles, MO 63303. Enter at Gate 2
    • Nearly 30,000 square feet filled with the best bargains in town! At this location, customers shop in comfort with wide aisles, cool temperatures (no matter how hot it gets outside), and plenty of convenient free parking.
  • Special Notes for 2024:
    • The 2024 Fair will NOT offer a large order staging area as in past years.
    • Donations are not accepted at the Fair.
    • The 2024 Friends Book Fair will include a silent auction. The auction will be happening in-person during the fair and will feature some of the more valuable materials that were donated this year.
    • Auction hours are 9:00am to 5:00 pm on Friday Only. Items must be picked up by 7:00 pm Friday.
  • Friday, August 2:
  • FRIENDS MEMBERS WILL ONCE AGAIN ENJOY ADVANCE SHOPPING HOURS
    • 9:00 am to noon - Friends members only admission
    • Friends memberships must be received by Friday, July 26 - Purchase a membership now
    • Friends memberships will be sold on Friday immediately after the 9 a.m. opening (Shop at 9:00 a.m. on Friday for the best selection.)
    • Noon to 9:00 p.m. - Open to the general public.
  • Saturday, August 3: 9:00 am to 7:00 pm
    • Open to the general public
  • Sunday, August 4: 10:00 am to 3:00 pm
    • Open to the general public
    • $5.00 a bag day (most items) Standard size plastic grocery bags provided on site.
  • BARGAIN PRICES - GREAT SELECTION:
  • CASH, CHECK or CREDIT accepted
    • Most hardbacks $2, regular size paperbacks 50 cents, oversize paperbacks $1
    • All children's and teen books 50 cents
    • Cake Pans $5
    • AV materials & adult graphic novels priced as marked
    • Some very old books, reference materials and special items are priced separately.
    • On Sunday, books are sold for $5.00 a bag-standard size grocery bags provided.
    • All books sorted into popular categories - easy to find the items you want!
  • Leftovers: The Friends will donate the 'leftovers' from the 2024 Summer Book Fair to nonprofit organizations (schools, churches, etc.) who can come on Sunday, August 4, between 1:00 and 3:00 p.m. and pick them up. Books will be given away on a first-come-first-serve basis. Nonprofit organizations interested in any of the leftover items should click here to sign up online or contact Jennifer Compton-Linden at 636-720-3267 prior to the Book Fair.

Aug 3 - 7
  • Friends of Rodman Library Annual Book Sale
  • 50,000+ Items!
  • Too many to display at once. Tables are restocked continuously. 
  • Hardbacks, Paperbacks, DVDs, CDs, and Magazines
    • 50% donated
    • Sorted, not picked over
    • 60% hardcover
    • 75% nonfiction, with History, Science, Cooking, Crafts, Travel, Religion, Art, Photography, Business, and much more
    • Children’s books
  • Raffle baskets $1.00 each or 6 for $5.00
  • This year the book sale will be held at the Alliance Commons
    • 405 S Linden Ave
    • Parking will be available at Rodman Public Library 
  • Entrance at Linden Avenue side of the building (front door)
  • Ramp and elevator available
  • Watch for directional signs
  • Saturday through Wednesday, August 3 - August 7
    • Saturday,  9AM - 5PM (Friends members only - memberships available at the door)
    • Sunday, 1PM - 5PM    (Open to the public)
    • Monday, 9AM - 8PM
    • Tuesday, 9AM - 8PM Special raffle basket ticket with purchase
    • Wednesday, 9AM - 8PM  Pay by donation all day
  • Attention: For safety reasons, the Saturday Friends sale has the following restriction: All strollers, large tubs, large bags, shopping carts, tubs on wheels, etc. are not permitted in the book sale area.
    • On Saturday & Sunday: 'TUB CORRAL' will be provided where large quantities can  be counted and priced.
  • Prices:
    • Hardback: $1.00 each
    • Paperback: 50¢ each
    • Children’s books 25¢ each/5 for $1.00
    • Magazines: 10¢ each/12 for $1.00
    • CDs: $1.00 per disc  DVDs: $1.00 per disc
  • Large selection of Collectible Books! Collectibles are listed on the Rodman Public Library website.  Click Here to see the 2024 Collectibles
  • Books are NOT picked over. NO buyer restrictions.
  • Cash, checks, debt/credit cards (4% processing fee on all cards)
  • The sale takes place during the week of the Carnation Festival

Library: AAUW and Kiwanis Club of Wooster
SaleDetails:
Sept 24 - 28
  • Wooster AAUW and Wooster Kiwanis clubs present our
    • 67th ANNUAL USED BOOK SALE!
  • Welcome to one of the largest fall  book sales in Ohio with over 45,000 books
  • Books are cleaned, sorted and categorized into over sixty categories!
    • Tables restocked continuously
    • 100% of books donated from the community
    • 75% Hardcover
  • ALL NEW SELECTIONS - No holdovers from last sale
  • No Restrictions on Buyer
  • September 24 to 28
    • Early Bird Sale (Tuesday, September 24th from 4 to 8 pm)
      • Open to all with $10 admission
    • Wednesday, 9 am to 8 pm
    • Thursday, 9 am to 8 pm
    • Friday, 9 am to 8 pm: half price day
    • Saturday, 9 am to 2 pm - $5 per standard-sized bag (provided free)
  • Great prices typically range from $1.00 to $6.00. Prices for rare and collectible books are typically 75% less than the online price for comparable books.
    • Free admission (except Tuesday Night Preview) and free parking every day
    • Keep Coming Back: Friday is ½ Price Day and Saturday is $5.00 Bag Day
    • Major Credit Cards Accepted / No taxes are collected
    • Separate Areas contain:
      • Fiction - 9 Categories
      • Nonfiction - 40+ Categories
      • Rare and Collectible - 3 Categories
      • Children's and Young Adult - 3 Categories
      • Recorded Books, Movie DVDs, Music CDs, and Puzzles - 4 Categories
  • All book sale proceeds support youth programs and scholarships for women whose education has been interrupted
  • For more information, go to: WoosterKiwanis.org or we can  be contacted at WoosterKiwanis@gmail.com or 330 439 2039

Sept 19 - 22
  • Mississauga Symphony Orchestra 29th Annual Used Book Sale
  • www.mississaugasymphony.ca
  • Sept. 19 – 22, 2024
    • Thursday: 5 p.m. – 9 p.m.
    • Friday: 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
    • Saturday: 10 a.m. – 4 p.m.
    • Sunday: 11 a.m. – 3 p.m. (Half Price)
  • Over 30, 000 items
    • Hardcovers and paperbacks, in excellent condition at great prices
    • Vinyl, CDs, DVDs, Puzzles, Games, Talking Books on CD
    • Sheet music, books of music, books about music and musicians of all eras
  • HIGHLIGHTS
    • Collectables/rare books, including a selection of books on movies and horror film production
    • NEW CATEGORY – BARGAIN BOOKS
    • Very large vinyl collection (33’s)
    • Hundreds of CDs - all checked – perfect condition
    • CD SPECIAL PRICING $1.00 EACH, including extensive collection of jazz CDs
    • DVD SPECIAL PRICING $2.00 EACH
  • Not picked over
  • Map available to assist you in finding your areas of interest
  • Free parking
  • New books added each day
  • CASH ONLY
  • Questions? Email:  usedbooksale@mississaugasymphony.ca
  • All proceeds go to Mississauga Symphony Orchestra (Registered Charitable Number 11904 3685 RR0001)
